nternalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"minimumTotalValue","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"nonFungibleContract","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract ERC721_","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"offerCut","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_newCEO","type":"address"}],"name":"setCEO","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_newCFO","type":"address"}],"name":"setCFO","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_newCOO","type":"address"}],"name":"setCOO","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_newDuration","type":"uint256"}],"name":"setGlobalDuration","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_newLostAndFound","type":"address"}],"name":"setLostAndFound","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_newMinimumPriceIncrement","type":"uint256"}],"name":"setMinimumPriceIncrement","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_newMinTotal","type":"uint256"}],"name":"setMinimumTotalValue","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_newOfferCut","type":"uint256"}],"name":"setOfferCut","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_newUnsuccessfulFee","type":"uint256"}],"name":"setUnsuccessfulFee","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"name":"tokenIdToOffer","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint64","name":"expiresAt","type":"uint64"},{"internalType":"address","name":"bidder","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint16","name":"offerCut","type":"uint16"},{"internalType":"uint128","name":"total","type":"uint128"},{"internalType":"uint128","name":"unsuccessfulFee","type":"uint128"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"totalCFOEarnings","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"totalLostAndFoundBalance","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"unsuccessfulFee","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_tokenId","type":"uint256"}],"name":"updateOffer","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"withdrawTotalCFOEarnings","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"withdrawTotalLostAndFoundBalance","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"stateMutability":"payable","type":"receive"}],"devdoc":{"author":"Dapper Labs Inc. (https://www.dapperlabs.com)","kind":"dev","methods":{"batchRemoveExpired(uint256[])":{"params":{"_tokenIds":"The array of tokenIds that will be removed from storage"}},"bidderWithdrawFunds(uint256)":{"params":{"_tokenId":"The token specified by the offer a bidder wants to withdraw funds for."}},"cancelOffer(uint256)":{"params":{"_tokenId":"The token specified by the offer a bidder wants to cancel"}},"constructor":{"params":{"_cooAddress":"The address of the COO to set","_globalDuration":"The initial globalDuration value to set","_minimumPriceIncrement":"The initial minimumPriceIncrement value to set","_minimumTotalValue":"The initial minimumTotalValue value to set","_nftAddress":"The address of the ERC-721 contract managing NFT ownership","_offerCut":"The initial offerCut value to set","_unsuccessfulFee":"The initial unsuccessfulFee value to set"}},"createOffer(uint256)":{"params":{"_tokenId":"The token a bidder wants to create an offer for."}},"freeze()":{"details":"A frozen contract will be frozen forever, there's no way to undo this action."},"fulfillOffer(uint256,uint128)":{"details":"We make sure that the token is not on auction when we fulfill an offer, because the owner of the  token would be the auction contract instead of the user. This function requires that this Offers contract  is approved for the token in order to make the call to transfer token ownership. This is sufficient  because approvals are cleared on transfer (including transfer to the auction).","params":{"_minOfferPrice":"The minimum price at which the owner of the token is happy to accept the offer.","_tokenId":"The token specified by the offer that will be fulfilled."}},"setCEO(address)":{"params":{"_newCEO":"The address of the new CEO"}},"setCFO(address)":{"params":{"_newCFO":"The address of the new CFO"}},"setCOO(address)":{"params":{"_newCOO":"The address of the new COO"}},"setGlobalDuration(uint256)":{"details":"Need to check for underflow since function argument is 256 bits, and the offer expiration time is  packed into 64 bits in the Offer struct.","params":{"_newDuration":"The globalDuration value to set."}},"setLostAndFound(address)":{"params":{"_newLostAndFound":"The address of the new lostAndFound address"}},"setMinimumPriceIncrement(uint256)":{"details":"As this configuration is a basis point, the value to set must be less than or equal to 10000.","params":{"_newMinimumPriceIncrement":"The minimumPriceIncrement value to set."}},"setMinimumTotalValue(uint256)":{"params":{"_newMinTotal":"The minimumTotalValue value to set"}},"setOfferCut(uint256)":{"details":"As this configuration is a basis point, the value to set must be less than or equal to 10000.","params":{"_newOfferCut":"The offerCut value to set."}},"setUnsuccessfulFee(uint256)":{"params":{"_newUnsuccessfulFee":"The unsuccessfulFee value to set."}},"updateOffer(uint256)":{"details":"We check msg.value to determine if the offer price should be raised. If 0, only a new  expiration time is set.","params":{"_tokenId":"The token specified by the offer that will be updated."}}},"stateVariables":{"InterfaceSignature_ERC721_":{"details":"The ERC-165 interface signature for ERC-721.  Ref: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/165  Ref: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/721"}},"title":"Contract that manages funds from creation to fulfillment for offers made on any ERC-721 token.","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"BidderWithdrewFundsWhenFrozen(uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"The BidderWithdrewFundsWhenFrozen event is emitted when a bidder withdrew their eth value of  the offer when the contract is frozen."},"ExpiredOfferRemoved(uint256,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"The ExpiredOfferRemoved event is emitted when an expired offer gets removed. The eth value will  be returned to the bidder's account, excluding the fee."},"OfferCancelled(uint256,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"The OfferCancelled event is emitted when an offer is cancelled before expired."},"OfferCreated(uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"The OfferCreated event is emitted when an offer is created through  createOffer method."},"OfferFulfilled(uint256,address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"The OfferFulfilled event is emitted when an active offer has been fulfilled, meaning  the bidder now owns the token, and the orignal owner receives the eth amount from the offer."},"OfferUpdated(uint256,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"The OfferUpdated event is emitted when an active offer was either extended the expiry  or raised the price."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"batchRemoveExpired(uint256[])":{"notice":"Removes any existing and inactive (expired) offers from storage. In doing so, this contract  takes a flat fee from the total amount attached to each offer before sending the remaining funds  back to the bidder.Nothing will be done if the offer for a token is either non-existent or active."},"bidderWithdrawFunds(uint256)":{"notice":"Sends funds of each existing offer held in escrow back to bidders. The function is callable  by anyone.Works only when contract is frozen. In this case, we want to allow all funds to be returned  without taking any fees."},"cancelOffer(uint256)":{"notice":"Cancels an offer that must exist and be active currently. This moves funds from this contract  back to the the bidder, after a cut has been taken.Works only when contract is not frozen."},"constructor":{"notice":"Creates the main Offers smart contract instance and sets initial configuration values"},"createOffer(uint256)":{"notice":"Creates an offer on a token. This contract receives bidders funds and refunds the previous bidder  if this offer overbids a previously active (unexpired) offer.When this offer overbids a previously active offer, this offer must have a price greater than  a certain percentage of the previous offer price, which the minimumOverbidPrice basis point specifies.  A flat fee is also taken from the previous offer before refund the previous bidder.When there is a previous offer that has already expired but not yet been removed from storage,  the new offer can be created with any total value as long as it is greater than the minimumTotalValue.Works only when contract is not frozen."},"freeze()":{"notice":"Called by CEO or CFO role to freeze the contract.  Only intended to be used if a serious exploit is detected.Allow two C-level roles to call this function in case either CEO or CFO key is compromised.This is a one-way process; there is no un-freezing."},"frozen()":{"notice":"Keeps track whether the contract is frozen.  When frozen is set to be true, it cannot be set back to false again,  and all whenNotFrozen actions will be blocked."},"fulfillOffer(uint256,uint128)":{"notice":"Fulfills an offer that must exist and be active currently. This moves the funds of the  offer held in escrow in this contract to the owner of the token, and atomically transfers the  token from the owner to the bidder. A cut is taken by this contract.We also acknowledge the paw-sible difficulties of keeping in-sync with the Ethereum  blockchain, and have allowed for fulfilling offers by specifying the _minOfferPrice at which the owner  of the token is happy to accept the offer. Thus, the owner will always receive the latest offer  price, which can only be at least the _minOfferPrice that was specified. Specifically, this  implementation is designed to prevent the edge case where the owner accidentally accepts an offer  with a price lower than intended. For example, this can happen when the owner fulfills the offer  precisely when the offer expires and is subsequently replaced with a new offer priced lower.Works only when contract is not frozen."},"setCEO(address)":{"notice":"Assigns a new address to act as the CEO. Only available to the current CEO."},"setCFO(address)":{"notice":"Assigns a new address to act as the CFO. Only available to the current CEO."},"setCOO(address)":{"notice":"Assigns a new address to act as the COO. Only available to the current CEO."},"setGlobalDuration(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the globalDuration value. All offers that are created or updated will compute a new expiration  time based on this.Only callable by COO, when not frozen."},"setLostAndFound(address)":{"notice":"Assigns a new address to act as the LostAndFound account. Only available to the current CEO."},"setMinimumPriceIncrement(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the minimumPriceIncrement value. All offers that are overbid must have a price greater  than the minimum increment computed from this basis point.Only callable by COO, when not frozen."},"setMinimumTotalValue(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the minimumTotalValue value. This would impact offers created after this has been set, but  not existing offers.Only callable by COO, when not frozen."},"setOfferCut(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the offerCut value. All offers will compute a fee taken by this contract based on this  configuration.Only callable by COO, when not frozen."},"setUnsuccessfulFee(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the unsuccessfulFee value. All offers that are unsuccessful (overbid or expired)  will have a flat fee taken by the main contract before being refunded to bidders.Given Tmin (_minTotal), flat fee (_unsuccessfulFee),  Tmin \u2265 (2 * flat fee) guarantees that offer prices \u2265 flat fee, always. This is important to prevent the  existence of offers that, when overbid or expired, would result in the main contract taking too big of a cut.  In the case of a sufficiently low offer price, eg. the same as unsuccessfulFee, the most the main contract can  ever take is simply the amount of unsuccessfulFee.Only callable by COO, when not frozen."},"tokenIdToOffer(uint256)":{"notice":"Mapping from token id to its corresponding offer."},"updateOffer(uint256)":{"notice":"Updates an existing and active offer by setting a new expiration time and, optionally, raise  the price of the offer.As the offers are always using the configuration values currently in storage, the updated  offer may be adhering to configuration values that are different at the time of its original creation."},"withdrawTotalCFOEarnings()":{"notice":"CFO withdraws the CFO earnings"},"withdrawTotalLostAndFoundBalance()":{"notice":"LostAndFound account withdraws all the lost and found amount"}},"notice":"This generic contract interfaces with any ERC-721 compliant contract","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"project:/contracts/Offers.sol":"Offers"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"project:/contracts/Offers.sol":{"keccak256":"0x593fa64a5e2848e6357c5538bfcca47bb4598fb0e0f92536e4cec3e214ebde96","license":"GPL-3.0","urls":["bzz-raw://d75691931e41cc52bff6c9c1f875a1eaae5190e9905688dfabd22488944aee08","dweb:/ipfs/QmQvivqrL3vFrwnYybiULGBKHnceQwTceTzbh4V3MoBSL7"]}},"version":1}

devdoc.author: Dapper Labs Inc. (https://www.dapperlabs.com)

params._tokenIds: The array of tokenIds that will be removed from storage

params._tokenId: The token specified by the offer a bidder wants to withdraw funds for.
The token specified by the offer a bidder wants to cancel

params._cooAddress: The address of the COO to set
params._globalDuration: The initial globalDuration value to set
params._minimumPriceIncrement: The initial minimumPriceIncrement value to set
params._minimumTotalValue: The initial minimumTotalValue value to set
params._nftAddress: The address of the ERC-721 contract managing NFT ownership
params._offerCut: The initial offerCut value to set
params._unsuccessfulFee: The initial unsuccessfulFee value to set

params._tokenId: The token a bidder wants to create an offer for.

freeze().details: A frozen contract will be frozen forever, there's no way to undo this action.

fulfillOffer(uint256,uint128).details: We make sure that the token is not on auction when we fulfill an offer, because the owner of the  token would be the auction contract instead of the user. This function requires that this Offers contract  is approved for the token in order to make the call to transfer token ownership. This is sufficient  because approvals are cleared on transfer (including transfer to the auction).

params._minOfferPrice: The minimum price at which the owner of the token is happy to accept the offer.
params._tokenId: The token specified by the offer that will be fulfilled.

params._newCEO: The address of the new CEO

params._newCFO: The address of the new CFO

params._newCOO: The address of the new COO

setGlobalDuration(uint256).details: Need to check for underflow since function argument is 256 bits, and the offer expiration time is  packed into 64 bits in the Offer struct.

params._newLostAndFound: The address of the new lostAndFound address

setMinimumPriceIncrement(uint256).details: As this configuration is a basis point, the value to set must be less than or equal to 10000.

setOfferCut(uint256).details: As this configuration is a basis point, the value to set must be less than or equal to 10000.

updateOffer(uint256).details: We check msg.value to determine if the offer price should be raised. If 0, only a new  expiration time is set.

params._tokenId: The token specified by the offer that will be updated.

InterfaceSignature_ERC721_.details: The ERC-165 interface signature for ERC-721.  Ref: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/165  Ref: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/721

devdoc.title: Contract that manages funds from creation to fulfillment for offers made on any ERC-721 token.

BidderWithdrewFundsWhenFrozen(uint256,ad.notice: The BidderWithdrewFundsWhenFrozen event is emitted when a bidder withdrew their eth value of  the offer when the contract is frozen.

ExpiredOfferRemoved(uint256,address,uint.notice: The ExpiredOfferRemoved event is emitted when an expired offer gets removed. The eth value will  be returned to the bidder's account, excluding the fee.

OfferCancelled(uint256,address,uint256,u.notice: The OfferCancelled event is emitted when an offer is cancelled before expired.

OfferCreated(uint256,address,uint256,uin.notice: The OfferCreated event is emitted when an offer is created through  createOffer method.

OfferFulfilled(uint256,address,address,u.notice: The OfferFulfilled event is emitted when an active offer has been fulfilled, meaning  the bidder now owns the token, and the orignal owner receives the eth amount from the offer.

OfferUpdated(uint256,address,uint256,uin.notice: The OfferUpdated event is emitted when an active offer was either extended the expiry  or raised the price.

batchRemoveExpired(uint256[]).notice: Removes any existing and inactive (expired) offers from storage. In doing so, this contract  takes a flat fee from the total amount attached to each offer before sending the remaining funds  back to the bidder.Nothing will be done if the offer for a token is either non-existent or active.

bidderWithdrawFunds(uint256).notice: Sends funds of each existing offer held in escrow back to bidders. The function is callable  by anyone.Works only when contract is frozen. In this case, we want to allow all funds to be returned  without taking any fees.

cancelOffer(uint256).notice: Cancels an offer that must exist and be active currently. This moves funds from this contract  back to the the bidder, after a cut has been taken.Works only when contract is not frozen.

constructor.notice: Creates the main Offers smart contract instance and sets initial configuration values

createOffer(uint256).notice: Creates an offer on a token. This contract receives bidders funds and refunds the previous bidder  if this offer overbids a previously active (unexpired) offer.When this offer overbids a previously active offer, this offer must have a price greater than  a certain percentage of the previous offer price, which the minimumOverbidPrice basis point specifies.  A flat fee is also taken from the previous offer before refund the previous bidder.When there is a previous offer that has already expired but not yet been removed from storage,  the new offer can be created with any total value as long as it is greater than the minimumTotalValue.Works only when contract is not frozen.

freeze().notice: Called by CEO or CFO role to freeze the contract.  Only intended to be used if a serious exploit is detected.Allow two C-level roles to call this function in case either CEO or CFO key is compromised.This is a one-way process; there is no un-freezing.

frozen().notice: Keeps track whether the contract is frozen.  When frozen is set to be true, it cannot be set back to false again,  and all whenNotFrozen actions will be blocked.

fulfillOffer(uint256,uint128).notice: Fulfills an offer that must exist and be active currently. This moves the funds of the  offer held in escrow in this contract to the owner of the token, and atomically transfers the  token from the owner to the bidder. A cut is taken by this contract.We also acknowledge the paw-sible difficulties of keeping in-sync with the Ethereum  blockchain, and have allowed for fulfilling offers by specifying the _minOfferPrice at which the owner  of the token is happy to accept the offer. Thus, the owner will always receive the latest offer  price, which can only be at least the _minOfferPrice that was specified. Specifically, this  implementation is designed to prevent the edge case where the owner accidentally accepts an offer  with a price lower than intended. For example, this can happen when the owner fulfills the offer  precisely when the offer expires and is subsequently replaced with a new offer priced lower.Works only when contract is not frozen.

setCEO(address).notice: Assigns a new address to act as the CEO. Only available to the current CEO.

setCFO(address).notice: Assigns a new address to act as the CFO. Only available to the current CEO.

setCOO(address).notice: Assigns a new address to act as the COO. Only available to the current CEO.

setGlobalDuration(uint256).notice: Sets the globalDuration value. All offers that are created or updated will compute a new expiration  time based on this.Only callable by COO, when not frozen.

setLostAndFound(address).notice: Assigns a new address to act as the LostAndFound account. Only available to the current CEO.

setMinimumPriceIncrement(uint256).notice: Sets the minimumPriceIncrement value. All offers that are overbid must have a price greater  than the minimum increment computed from this basis point.Only callable by COO, when not frozen.

setMinimumTotalValue(uint256).notice: Sets the minimumTotalValue value. This would impact offers created after this has been set, but  not existing offers.Only callable by COO, when not frozen.

setOfferCut(uint256).notice: Sets the offerCut value. All offers will compute a fee taken by this contract based on this  configuration.Only callable by COO, when not frozen.

setUnsuccessfulFee(uint256).notice: Sets the unsuccessfulFee value. All offers that are unsuccessful (overbid or expired)  will have a flat fee taken by the main contract before being refunded to bidders.Given Tmin (_minTotal), flat fee (_unsuccessfulFee),  Tmin ≥ (2 * flat fee) guarantees that offer prices ≥ flat fee, always. This is important to prevent the  existence of offers that, when overbid or expired, would result in the main contract taking too big of a cut.  In the case of a sufficiently low offer price, eg. the same as unsuccessfulFee, the most the main contract can  ever take is simply the amount of unsuccessfulFee.Only callable by COO, when not frozen.

tokenIdToOffer(uint256).notice: Mapping from token id to its corresponding offer.

updateOffer(uint256).notice: Updates an existing and active offer by setting a new expiration time and, optionally, raise  the price of the offer.As the offers are always using the configuration values currently in storage, the updated  offer may be adhering to configuration values that are different at the time of its original creation.

withdrawTotalLostAndFoundBalance().notice: LostAndFound account withdraws all the lost and found amount

userdoc.notice: This generic contract interfaces with any ERC-721 compliant contract
